This, guys, is important to get right. They all sound quite similar and in fact many natives get it wrong, but that should be no excuse for you.

 

Those who do get it wrong, immediately show their lack of proper education. And that’s certainly not the message you want to send.

 

Let’s break these three down!

 

They’re is a shortened form of they are. Hence, it is the verb to be with its corresponding pronoun of the 3rd person plural. (We/You/They)

These are all sentences which you can form with they’re. If you listen carefully, you will also notice that the emphasis lies on the first part of the word and there is a slight pause between they and ‘re.

In most cases, the presence of an apostrophe, or this symbol ‘ means there is something missing. In this case, the letter a was removed so the two words they and are can be merged for easier pronunciation.

|They are here| and |They’re here| both have the same meaning, but the second version is faster and easier to pronounce.

Examples:

|They’re having fun| |They’re beautiful| |They’re here|

********

Their is related to they’re in the way that their belongs to they. Their is a possessive pronoun. It indicates belonging to somebody. Any time a group in 3rd person plural (they) has or possesses something, we use their to indicate this.

|Their house.| |Their friend.| |Their clothes.|

********

There is a whole other story. There indicates a location. There is slightly further away than here. It’s easy to remember because it’s just one letter away from here!

“Where is my key?” — “Ah, over there!”

Pair there together with the question word where and you have another aid to memory. See the similarity in spelling?

 

Between their and there, there’s practically no difference in pronunciation.

 

We can even use all three words in one sentence.

 

|They’re = Person|

|There = Location|

|Their = Belonging|

 

|They’re sitting over there in their car.|

 

And there you have it. One quick fix to a common mistake:

 

They’re is a shorter version of they are.

There means something is not here, but there.

Their means something belongs to someone.
